intro: Alectorolophus pseudolanceolatus, commonly known as the slender-leafed pterostigma, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, lance-shaped leaves with a prominent pterostigma. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are small and clustered, often with white or pale green petals. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique leaf morphology and ecological adaptations.
